All min- / max-parameters are dilated or scaled down by a certain percentage. This new parameterset is used for additional classification. Pores which come in addition are marked in blue, pores which dissapear are marked in magenta. This additional classification serves as parameterization aid and does not influence the result. If the value is zero, nothing happens.

Precitec.Filter.BlobAdapter.Beschreibung.Text: This filter offers the possibility to extract one value out of the pore analysis.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.BlobAdapter.Bl.Text: Specifies which value should be extracted from a detected pore.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.BlobDetectionT.Text: Maximal number of blobs to be found.
Minimal blob size, which is found.
Minimal blob size, which is found.

Precitec.Filter.BoundingBox.Beschreibung.Text: Computes the maximal dilation of a pore in X and Y direction.

Precitec.Filter.BoundingBox.Tooltip.Text: Maximal dilation of a pore in X and Y direction.

Precitec.Filter.GradientPore.Beschreibun.Text: Calculates the gradient between the intensities (contrast) within the pore and out of the pore.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.GradientPore.N.Text: Number of the inner and outer neighbor pixels perpendicular to the pore contour, which are used for contrast calculation.
Number of the inner and outer neighbor pixels perpendicular to the pore contour, which are used for contrast calculation.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.GradientPore.O.Text: Distance between the pore and the outer neighbor pixels, which are used for contrast calculation.
Distance between the pore and the outer neighbor pixels, which are used for contrast calculation.

Precitec.Filter.PrincipalComponents.Besc.Text: Computes lengths and ratio of the principal components.

Precitec.Filter.PrincipalComponents.Tool.Text: Lengths and ratio of the principal components.

Precitec.Filter.StatisticalMoments.Besch.Text: Compute statistical moments of an image.

Precitec.Filter.StatisticalMoments.Toolt.Text: Compute statistical moments of an images.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.StatisticalMom.Text: Order: Compute Moments up to this order.
Choose between centralized (relative to center of mass) and standard moments (relative to origin of image).

Precitec.Filter.Surface.Beschreibung.Text: Calculates a surface feature of a blob, e.g. variance. Calculation base are the intensities within the scaled bounding box of a blob.

Precitec.Filter.Surface.Tooltip.Text: Calculates a surface feature of a blob, e.g. variance.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.Surface.Boundi.Text: Scaling factor to make the bounding box of a blob bigger or smaller.
Scaling factor to make the bounding box of a blob bigger or smaller.

Precitec.Filter.PoreDetection.Beschreibu.Text: Finds Blobs and classify them as pore, if all features lie in the set range. To find the blobs the image will be binarized and small particels removed, holes closed. Calculates the features to decide if the blob is a pore or not. First Output: Number found pores, Second: size of biggest pore.

Precitec.Filter.Attribute.PoreDetection..Text: Number active parameter sets. If not all three activated: the active sets starting left.

To select for each parameter the indiviual visualization mode. Value info box is shown for all selections except 'none'. Selection 'contour': bounding box is shown too, if 'verbosity' is at least medium.
Distance to mean image intensity: Less then will be turned into a black pixel, more than into a white pixel.

For binarizing two modes of thresholding may be chosen: 1) Global mean image intensity with offset: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset 2) Local mean image intensity plus offset: Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighborhood.
Global: Threshold is global mean image intensity plus offset; Local: Local intensity is calculated within 20 X 20 pixels neighborhood.
Global mean image intensity with offset
Local mean image intensity with offset
Morphology: Closes holes and removes small particels. This parameter tells how often these operations should be executed.
Morphology operations: closing holes and remove small particels.
Maximal number of pores to be found.
Minimal blob size which is found.
Scaling factor to make the bounding box of a blob bigger or smaller. Used to calculate the surface feature variance the blobs.
Scaling factor to calculate the surface feature variance of the blobs.
Number of the inner and outer neighbor pixels perpendicular to the pore contour, which are used for contrast calculation.
Distance between the pore and the outer neighbor pixels, which are used for contrast calculation.
Minimal value for the feature 'width' (bounding box width) to classify if blob is pore.
Maximal value for the feature 'width' (bounding box width) to classify if blob is pore.
Minimal value for the feature 'height' (bounding box height) to classify if blob is pore.
Maximal value for the feature 'height' (bounding box height) to classify if blob is pore.
Minimal value for the feature 'shape' (principal component ratio of blob) to classify if blob is a pore.
Maximal value for the feature 'shape' (principal component ratio of blob) to classify if blob is a pore.
Minimal value for the feature 'contrast' (contrast to direct neighboorhood) to classify if blob is a pore.
Maximal value for the feature 'contrast' (contrast to direct neighboorhood) to classify if blob is a pore.
Minimal value for the feature 'surface' to classify blob as a pore.
Maximal value for the feature 'surface' to classify blob as a pore.

All min- / max-parameters are dilated or scaled down by a certain percentage. This new parameterset is used for additional classification. Pores which come in addition are marked in blue, pores which dissapear are marked in magenta. This additional classification serves as parameterization aid and does not influence the result. If the value is zero, nothing happens.
Scales all min-/max-parameters. This new parameterset is used for additional classification. Value zero: nothing happens.
